title: ICE on nightly arm compiling proc-macro2

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: E-needs-mcve
labels.description: Call for participation: This issue needs a Minimal Complete and Verifiable Example

body:
Hi, I found this when trying to `cargo install cargo-web` on my raspberry pi. Looks like there is an ICE when compiling the proc-macro2 crate.

```
thread 'main' panicked at 'called `Result::unwrap()` on an `Err` value: Utf8Error { valid_up_to: 1, error_len: Some(1) }', libcore/result.rs:945:5
note: Run with `RUST_BACKTRACE=1` for a backtrace.

error: internal compiler error: unexpected panic

note: the compiler unexpectedly panicked. this is a bug.

note: we would appreciate a bug report: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#bug-reports

note: rustc 1.29.0-nightly (866a71325 2018-07-29) running on armv7-unknown-linux-gnueabihf

note: compiler flags: -C opt-level=3 --crate-type lib

note: some of the compiler flags provided by cargo are hidden
```

The proc macro version is 0.4.9

Edit: I also get the same error when compiling `pear_codegen`
Edit2: I grabbed a backtrace of the `pear_codegen` failure since it was quicker to reproduce on my slow machine:

